csharp.using: System, System.Collections.Generic, System.Text, System.Diagnostics, System.Xml.Serialization, DISnet.DataStreamUtilities

class.name: AngularVelocityVector
class.comment: 5.2.2: angular velocity measured in radians per second out each of the entity's own coordinate axes.

class.name: UnsignedIntegerWrapper
class.comment: Wrapper for an unsigned 32 bit integer

attribute.name: wrapper
attribute.comment: name can't be too accurate or the generated source code will have reserved word problems

class.name: AntennaLocation
class.comment: 5.2.3: location of the radiating portion of the antenna, specified in world coordinates and entity coordinates.

attribute.name: antennaLocation
attribute.comment: Location of the radiating portion of the antenna in world coordinates

attribute.name: relativeAntennaLocation
attribute.comment: Location of the radiating portion of the antenna in entity coordinates

class.name: BeamAntennaPattern
class.comment: Section 5.2.4.2. Used when the antenna pattern type field has a value of 1. Specifies the direction, patter, and polarization of radiation from an antenna.

attribute.name: beamDirection
attribute.comment: The rotation that transformst he reference coordinate sytem into the beam coordinate system. Either world coordinates or entity coordinates may be used as the reference coordinate system, as specified by teh reference system field of the antenna pattern record.

attribute.name: azimuthBeamwidth
attribute.commment: Full width of the beam to the -3dB power density points in the x-y plane of the beam coordinnate system. Elevation beamwidth is represented by a 32 bit floating point number in units of radians.

attribute.name: elevationBeamwidth
attribute.commment: The full width of the beam to the –3 dB power density points in the x-z plane of the beam coordinate system. Elevation beamwidth shall be represented by a 32-bit floating point number in units of radians.

attribute.name: referenceSystem
attribute.commment: The reference coordinate system wrt which beam direction is specified. This field should not change over the duration of an exercise. World coordindate systemis prefered for exercises. The entity coordinate system should be used only when highly directional antennas must be precisely modeled.

attribute.name: ez
attribute.comment: Magnigute of the z-component in beam coordinates at some arbitrary single point in the mainbeam and in the far field of the antenna.

attribute.name: ex
attribute.comment: Magnigute of the x-component in beam coordinates at some arbitrary single point in the mainbeam and in the far field of the antenna.

attribute.name: phase
attribute.comment: THe phase angle between Ez and Ex in radians.

class.name: SphericalHarmonicAntennaPattern
class.comment: Section 5.2.4.3. Used when the antenna pattern type in the transmitter pdu is of value 2. Specified the direction and radiation pattern from a radio transmitter's antenna. NOTE: this class must be hand-coded to clean up some implementation details.

attribute.name: harmonicOrder
attribute.commment: The highest order of the expansion in spherical harmonics, counting from zero. There are 2n+1 coefficients for each order n, and a total of N^2 + 2N + 1 coefficients through order N. note that order by itself is a sql reserved word

class.name: ArticulationParameter
class.comment: Section 5.2.5. Articulation parameters for movable parts and attached parts of an entity. Specifes wether or not a change has occured, the part identifcation of the articulated part to which it is attached, and the type and value of each parameter.

class.name: BurstDescriptor
class.comment: Section 5.2.7. Specifies the type of muntion fired, the type of warhead, the type of fuse, the number of rounds fired, and the rate at which the roudns are fired in rounds per minute.

attribute.name: munition
attribute.comment: What munition was used in the burst

attribute.name: quantity
attribute.comment: how many of the munition were fired

attribute.name: rate
attribute.comment: rate at which the munition was fired

class.name: ClockTime
class.comment: Section 5.2.8. Time measurements that exceed one hour. Hours is the number of hours since January 1, 1970, UTC

class.name: EmitterSystem
class.comment: Section 5.2.11. This field shall specify information about a particular emitter system

attribute.name: emitterName
attribute.comment: Name of the emitter, 16 bit enumeration

attribute.name: function
attribute.comment: function of the emitter, 8 bit enumeration

class.name: SimulationAddress
class.comment: Section 5.2.14.1. A Simulation Address record shall consist of the Site Identification number and the Application Identification number.

class.name: EntityType
class.comment: Section 5.2.16. Identifies the type of entity, including kind of entity, domain (surface, subsurface, air, etc) country, category, etc.

attribute.name: domain
attribute.comment: Domain of entity (air, surface, subsurface, space, etc)

attribute.name: country
attribute.comment: country to which the design of the entity is attributed

attribute.name: spec
attribute.comment: specific info based on subcategory field. Renamed from specific because that is a reserved word in SQL

class.name: ObjectType
class.comment: Identifies type of object. This is a shorter version of EntityType that omits the specific and extra fields.

attribute.name: domain
attribute.comment: Domain of entity (air, surface, subsurface, space, etc)

attribute.name: country
attribute.comment: country to which the design of the entity is attributed

class.name: Orientation
class.comment: Section 5.2.17. Three floating point values representing an orientation, psi, theta, and phi, aka the euler angles, in radians

class.name: EventID
class.comment: Section 5.2.18. Identifies a unique event in a simulation via the combination of three values

class.name: FixedDatum
class.comment: Section 5.2.18. Fixed Datum Record

class.name: FundamentalParameterData
class.comment: Section 5.2.22. Contains electromagnetic emmision regineratin parameters that are variable throughout a scenario dependent on the actions of the participants in the simulation. Also provides basic parametric data that may be used to support low-fidelity simulations.

attribute.name: frequency
attribute.comment: center frequency of the emission in hertz.

attribute.name: frequencyRange
attribute.comment: Bandwidth of the frequencies corresponding to the fequency field.

attribute.name: effectiveRadiatedPower
attribute.comment: Effective radiated power for the emission in DdBm. For a radar noise jammer, indicates the peak of the transmitted power.

attribute.name: pulseRepetitionFrequency
attribute.comment: Average repetition frequency of the emission in hertz.

attribute.name: pulseWidth
attribute.comment: Average pulse width of the emission in microseconds.

attribute.name: beamAzimuthCenter
attribute.comment: Specifies the beam azimuth an elevation centers and corresponding half-angles to describe the scan volume

attribute.name: beamAzimuthSweep
attribute.comment: Specifies the beam azimuth sweep to determine scan volume

attribute.name: beamElevationCenter
attribute.comment: Specifies the beam elevation center to determine scan volume

attribute.name: beamElevationSweep
attribute.comment: Specifies the beam elevation sweep to determine scan volume

attribute.name: beamSweepSync
attribute.comment: allows receiver to synchronize its regenerated scan pattern to that of the emmitter. Specifies the percentage of time a scan is through its pattern from its origion.

class.name: RadioEntityType
class.comment: Section 5.2.25. Identifies the type of radio

attribute.name: domain
attribute.comment: Domain of entity (air, surface, subsurface, space, etc)

attribute.name: country
attribute.comment: country to which the design of the entity is attributed

attribute.name: nomenclatureVersion
attribute.comment: specific info based on subcategory field

class.name: SupplyQuantity
class.comment: Section 5.2.30. A supply, and the amount of that supply. Similar to an entity kind but with the addition of a quantity.

class.name: VariableDatum
class.comment: Section 5.2.32. Variable Datum Record

attribute.name: variableDatumLength
attribute.comment: length of the variable datums, in bits. Note that this is not programmatically tied to the size of the variableData. The variable data field may be 64 bits long but only 16 bits of it could actually be used.

attribute.name: variableData
attribute.comment: data can be any length, but must increase in 8 byte quanta. This requires some postprocessing patches. Note that setting the data allocates a new internal array to account for the possibly increased size. The default initial size is 64 bits.

class.name: AcousticEmitter
class.comment: Section 5.2.35. information about a specific UA emmtter

attribute.name: acousticName
attribute.comment: the system for a particular UA emitter, and an enumeration

attribute.name: function
attribute.comment: The function of the acoustic system

attribute.name: acousticIdNumber
attribute.comment: The UA emitter identification number relative to a specific system

class.name: TrackJamTarget
class.comment: One track/jam target

class.name: ElectronicEmissionBeamData
class.comment: Description of one electronic emission beam

attribute.name: beamDataLength
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the length of this beams data in 32 bit words

attribute.name: beamIDNumber
attribute.comment: This field shall specify a unique emitter database number assigned to differentiate between otherwise similar or identical emitter beams within an emitter system.

attribute.name: beamParameterIndex
attribute.comment: This field shall specify a Beam Parameter Index number that shall be used by receiving entities in conjunction with the Emitter Name field to provide a pointer to the stored database parameters required to regenerate the beam.

attribute.name: fundamentalParameterData
attribute.comment: Fundamental parameter data such as frequency range, beam sweep, etc.

attribute.name: beamFunction
attribute.comment: beam function of a particular beam

attribute.name: highDensityTrackJam
attribute.comment: wheher or not the receiving simulation apps can assume all the targets in the scan pattern are being tracked/jammed

attribute.name: trackJamTargets
attribute.comment: variable length list of track/jam targets

class.name: ElectronicEmissionSystemData
class.comment: Data about one electronic system

attribute.name: systemDataLength
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the length of this emitter system�s data (including beam data and its track/jam information) in 32-bit words. The length shall include the System Data Length field.

attribute.name: numberOfBeams
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the number of beams being described in the current PDU for the system being described.

attribute.name: emitterSystem
attribute.comment: This field shall specify information about a particular emitter system

attribute.name: location
attribute.comment: Location with respect to the entity

attribute.name: beamDataRecords
attribute.comment: variable length list of beam data records

class.name: AggregateID
class.comment: Section 5.2.36. Each agregate in a given simulation app is given an aggregate identifier number unique for all other aggregates in that app and in that exercise. The id is valid for the duration of the the exercise.

class.name: Marking
class.comment: Section 5.2.15. Specifies the character set used inthe first byte, followed by 11 characters of text data.

class.name: AggregateMarking
class.comment: Section 5.2.37. Specifies the character set used inthe first byte, followed by up to 31 characters of text data.

class.name: AggregateType
class.comment: Section 5.2.38. Identifies the type of aggregate including kind of entity, domain (surface, subsurface, air, etc) country, category, etc.

attribute.name: domain
attribute.comment: Domain of entity (air, surface, subsurface, space, etc)

attribute.name: country
attribute.comment: country to which the design of the entity is attributed

attribute.name: specificInfo
attribute.comment: specific info based on subcategory field, sql has a reserved word for specific

class.name: BeamData
class.comment: Section 5.2.39. Specification of the data necessary to describe the scan volume of an emitter.

attribute.name: beamAzimuthCenter
attribute.comment: Specifies the beam azimuth an elevation centers and corresponding half-angles to describe the scan volume

attribute.name: beamAzimuthSweep
attribute.comment: Specifies the beam azimuth sweep to determine scan volume

attribute.name: beamElevationCenter
attribute.comment: Specifies the beam elevation center to determine scan volume

attribute.name: beamElevationSweep
attribute.comment: Specifies the beam elevation sweep to determine scan volume

attribute.name: beamSweepSync
attribute.comment: allows receiver to synchronize its regenerated scan pattern to that of the emmitter. Specifies the percentage of time a scan is through its pattern from its origion.

class.name: Environment
class.comment: Section 5.2.40. Information about a geometry, a state associated with a geometry, a bounding volume, or an associated entity ID. NOTE: this class requires hand coding.

attribute.name: recordIndex
attribute.comment: Identify the sequentially numbered record index

attribute.name: padding2
attribute.comment: padding to bring the total size up to a 64 bit boundry

class.name: Vector3Float
class.comment: Section 5.2.33. Three floating point values, x, y, and z

class.name: Vector3Double
class.comment: Section 5.3.34. Three double precision floating point values, x, y, and z

class.name: EntityID
class.comment: Each entity in a given DIS simulation application shall be given an entity identifier number unique to all other entities in that application. This identifier number is valid for the duration of the exercise; however, entity identifier numbers may be reused when all possible numbers have been exhausted. No entity shall have an entity identifier number of NO_ENTITY, ALL_ENTITIES, or RQST_ASSIGN_ID. The entity iden- tifier number need not be registered or retained for future exercises. The entity identifier number shall be specified by a 16-bit unsigned integer. An entity identifier number equal to zero with valid site and application identification shall address a simulation application. An entity identifier number equal to ALL_ENTITIES shall mean all entities within the specified site and application. An entity identifier number equal to RQST_ASSIGN_ID allows the receiver of the create entity to define the entity identifier number of the new entity.

class.name: ShaftRPMs
class.comment: Shaft RPMs, used in underwater acoustic clacluations.

attribute.name: shaftRPMRateOfChange
attribute.comment: rate of change of shaft RPMs

class.name: PropulsionSystemData
class.comment: Data about a propulsion system

class.name: VectoringNozzleSystemData
class.comment: Data about a vectoring nozzle system

class.name: AcousticEmitterSystem
class.comment: 5.3.35: Information about a particular UA emitter shall be represented using an Acoustic Emitter System record. This record shall consist of three fields: Acoustic Name, Function, and Acoustic ID Number

attribute.name: acousticName
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the system for a particular UA emitter.

attribute.name: acousticFunction
attribute.comment: This field shall describe the function of the acoustic system.

attribute.name: acousticID
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the UA emitter identification number relative to a specific system. This field shall be represented by an 8-bit unsigned integer. This field allows the differentiation of multiple systems on an entity, even if in some instances two or more of the systems may be identical UA emitter types. Numbering of systems shall begin with the value 1.

class.name: AcousticEmitterSystemData
class.comment: Used in the UA pdu; ties together an emmitter and a location. This requires manual cleanup; the beam data should not be attached to each emitter system.

attribute.name: acousticEmitterSystem
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the system for a particular UA emitter.

attribute.name: emitterLocation
attribute.comment: Represents the location wrt the entity

attribute.name: beamRecords
attribute.comment: For each beam in numberOfBeams, an emitter system. This is not right--the beam records need to be at the end of the PDU, rather than attached to each system.

class.name: AcousticBeamData
class.comment: Used in UA PDU

class.name: AcousticBeamFundamentalParameter
class.comment: Used in UaPdu

class.name: ApaData
class.comment: Used in UA PDU

class.name: IffFundamentalData
class.comment: 5.2.42. Basic operational data ofr IFF ATC NAVAIDS

class.name: IntercomCommunicationsParameters
class.comment: 5.2.46. Intercom communcations parameters

attribute.name: recordLength
attribute.comment: length of record-specifid field, in octets

attribute.name: parameterValues
attribute.comment: variable length list of data parameters

class.name: LayerHeader
class.comment: 5.2.47. Layer header.

class.name: SystemID
class.comment: 5.2.58. Used in IFF ATC PDU

class.name: FundamentalParameterDataIff
class.comment: 5.2.45. Fundamental IFF atc data

class.name: GridAxisRecord
class.comment: 5.2.43: Grid axis record for fixed data

attribute.name: domainInitialXi
attribute.comment: coordinate of the grid origin or initial value

attribute.name: domainFinalXi
attribute.comment: coordinate of the endpoint or final value

attribute.name: domainPointsXi
attribute.comment: The number of grid points along the Xi domain axis for the enviornmental state data

attribute.name: interleafFactor
attribute.comment: interleaf factor along the domain axis.

attribute.name: numberOfPointsOnXiAxis
attribute.comment: Number of grid locations along Xi axis

attribute.name: initialIndex
attribute.comment: initial grid point for the current pdu

class.name: GridAxisRecord
class.comment: 5.2.44: Grid data record, a common abstract superclass for several subtypes

class.name: GridAxisRecordRepresentation0
class.comment: 5.2.44: Grid data record, representation 0

attribute.name: numberOfBytes
attribute.comment: number of bytes of environmental state data

attribute.name: dataValues
attribute.comment: variable length list of data parameters ^^^this is wrong--need padding as well

class.name: GridAxisRecordRepresentation1
class.comment: 5.2.44: Grid data record, representation 1

attribute.name: fieldOffset
attribute.comment: constant offset used to scale grid data

attribute.name: dataValues
attribute.comment: variable length list of data parameters ^^^this is wrong--need padding as well

class.name: GridAxisRecordRepresentation2
class.comment: 5.2.44: Grid data record, representation 1

attribute.name: dataValues
attribute.comment: variable length list of data parameters ^^^this is wrong--need padding as well

class.name: SixByteChunk
class.comment: 48 bit piece of data

class.name: LinearSegmentParameter
class.comment: 5.2.48: Linear segment parameters

class.name: EightByteChunk
class.comment: 64 bit piece of data

class.name: OneByteChunk
class.comment: 8 bit piece of data

class.name: TwoByteChunk
class.comment: 16 bit piece of data

class.name: FourByteChunk
class.comment: 32 bit piece of data

class.name: Point
class.comment: x,y point

class.name: ModulationType
class.comment: Radio modulation

class.name: Relationship
class.comment: 5.2.56. Purpose for joinging two entities

class.name: NamedLocation
class.comment: discrete ostional relationsihip

class.name: DeadReckoningParameter
class.comment: represents values used in dead reckoning algorithms

attribute.name: deadReckoningAlgorithm
attribute.comment: enumeration of what dead reckoning algorighm to use

attribute.name: otherParameters
attribute.comment: other parameters to use in the dead reckoning algorithm

class.name: RecordSet
class.comment: Record sets, used in transfer control request PDU

class.name: PduStream
class.comment: Non-DIS class, used to describe streams of PDUs when logging to SQL databases

attribute.name: shortDescription
attribute.comment: short description of this PDU stream

attribute.name: longDescription
attribute.comment: Longish description of this PDU stream

attribute.name: startTime
attribute.comment: Start time of recording, in Unix time

attribute.name: stopTime
attribute.comment: stop time of recording, in Unix time

attribute.name: pduCount
attribute.comment: how many PDUs in this stream

class.name: Pdu
class.comment: The superclass for all PDUs. This incorporates the PduHeader record, section 5.2.29.

attribute.name: pduType
attribute.comment: Type of pdu, unique for each PDU class

attribute.name: protocolFamily
attribute.comment: value that refers to the protocol family, eg SimulationManagement, et

attribute.name: pduLength
attribute.comment: Length, in bytes, of the PDU. Changed name from length to avoid use of Hibernate QL reserved word

class.name: EntityInformationFamilyPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.3. Common superclass for EntityState, Collision, collision-elastic, and entity state update PDUs. This should be abstract. COMPLETE

class.name: EntityStatePdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.3.1. Represents the postion and state of one entity in the world. COMPLETE

attribute.name: entityID
attribute.comment: Unique ID for an entity that is tied to this state information

attribute.name: forceId
attribute.comment: What force this entity is affiliated with, eg red, blue, neutral, etc

attribute.name: numberOfArticulationParameters
attribute.comment: How many articulation parameters are in the variable length list

attribute.name: entityType
attribute.comment: Describes the type of entity in the world

attribute.name: entityLinearVelocity
attribute.comment: Describes the speed of the entity in the world

attribute.name: entityLocation
attribute.comment: describes the location of the entity in the world

attribute.name: entityOrientation
attribute.comment: describes the orientation of the entity, in euler angles

attribute.name: entityAppearance
attribute.comment: a series of bit flags that are used to help draw the entity, such as smoking, on fire, etc.

flag.name: damage
flag.comment: 0 no damage, 1 slight damage, 2 moderate, 3 destroyed

flag.name: smoke
flag.comment: 0 no smoke, 1 smoke plume, 2 engine smoke, 3 engine smoke and plume

flag.name: trailingEffects
flag.comment: dust cloud, 0 none 1 small 2 medium 3 large

flag.name: hatch
flag.comment: 0 NA 1 closed popped 3 popped and person visible 4 open 5 open and person visible

attribute.name: marking
attribute.comment: characters that can be used for debugging, or to draw unique strings on the side of entities in the world

attribute.name: articulationParameters
attribute.comment: variable length list of articulation parameters

class.name: FastEntityStatePdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.3.1. Represents the postion and state of one entity in the world. This is identical in function to entity state pdu, but generates less garbage to collect in the Java world. COMPLETE

attribute.name: forceId
attribute.comment: what force this entity is affiliated with, eg red, blue, neutral, etc

attribute.name: numberOfArticulationParameters
attribute.comment: How many articulation parameters are in the variable length list

attribute.name: domain
attribute.comment: Domain of entity (air, surface, subsurface, space, etc)

attribute.name: country
attribute.comment: country to which the design of the entity is attributed

attribute.name: specif
attribute.comment: specific info based on subcategory field. Name changed from specific because that is a reserved word in SQL.

attribute.name: altDomain
attribute.comment: Domain of entity (air, surface, subsurface, space, etc)

attribute.name: altCountry
attribute.comment: country to which the design of the entity is attributed

attribute.name: altSpecific
attribute.comment: specific info based on subcategory field

attribute.name: entityAppearance
attribute.comment: a series of bit flags that are used to help draw the entity, such as smoking, on fire, etc.

flag.name: damage
flag.comment: 0 no damage, 1 slight damage, 2 moderate, 3 destroyed

flag.name: smoke
flag.comment: 0 no smoke, 1 smoke plume, 2 engine smoke, 3 engine smoke and plume

flag.name: trailingEffects
flag.comment: dust cloud, 0 none 1 small 2 medium 3 large

flag.name: hatch
flag.comment: 0 NA 1 closed popped 3 popped and person visible 4 open 5 open and person visible

attribute.name: deadReckoningAlgorithm
attribute.comment: enumeration of what dead reckoning algorighm to use

attribute.name: otherParameters
attribute.comment: other parameters to use in the dead reckoning algorithm

attribute.name: marking
attribute.comment: characters that can be used for debugging, or to draw unique strings on the side of entities in the world

attribute.name: articulationParameters
attribute.comment: variable length list of articulation parameters

class.name: CollisionPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.3.2. Information about a collision. COMPLETE

attribute.name: issuingEntityID
attribute.comment: ID of the entity that issued the collision PDU

attribute.name: collidingEntityID
attribute.comment: ID of entity that has collided with the issuing entity ID

attribute.name: location
attribute.comment: Location with respect to entity the issuing entity collided with

class.name: CollisionElasticPdu
class.comment: 5.3.3.3. Information about elastic collisions in a DIS exercise shall be communicated using a Collision-Elastic PDU. COMPLETE

attribute.name: issuingEntityID
attribute.comment: ID of the entity that issued the collision PDU

attribute.name: collidingEntityID
attribute.comment: ID of entity that has collided with the issuing entity ID

attribute.name: location
attribute.comment: Location with respect to entity the issuing entity collided with

attribute.name: unitSurfaceNormal
attribute.comment: This record shall represent the normal vector to the surface at the point of collision detection. The surface normal shall be represented in world coordinates.

attribute.name: coefficientOfRestitution
attribute.comment: This field shall represent the degree to which energy is conserved in a collision

class.name: EntityStateUpdatePdu
class.comment: 5.3.3.4. Nonstatic information about a particular entity may be communicated by issuing an Entity State Update PDU. COMPLETE

attribute.name: entityID
attribute.comment: This field shall identify the entity issuing the PDU

attribute.name: numberOfArticulationParameters
attribute.comment: How many articulation parameters are in the variable length list

attribute.name: entityLinearVelocity
attribute.comment: Describes the speed of the entity in the world

attribute.name: entityLocation
attribute.comment: describes the location of the entity in the world

attribute.name: entityOrientation
attribute.comment: describes the orientation of the entity, in euler angles

attribute.name: entityAppearance
attribute.comment: a series of bit flags that are used to help draw the entity, such as smoking, on fire, etc.

flag.name: damage
flag.comment: 0 no damage, 1 slight damage, 2 moderate, 3 destroyed

flag.name: smoke
flag.comment: 0 no smoke, 1 smoke plume, 2 engine smoke, 3 engine smoke and plume

flag.name: trailingEffects
flag.comment: dust cloud, 0 none 1 small 2 medium 3 large

flag.name: hatch
flag.comment: 0 NA 1 closed popped 3 popped and person visible 4 open 5 open and person visible

class.name: WarfareFamilyPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.4. abstract superclass for fire and detonation pdus that have shared information. COMPLETE

attribute.name: firingEntityID
attribute.comment: ID of the entity that shot

attribute.name: targetEntityID
attribute.comment: ID of the entity that is being shot at

class.name: FirePdu
class.comment: Sectioin 5.3.4.1. Information about someone firing something. COMPLETE

attribute.name: munitionID
attribute.comment: ID of the munition that is being shot

attribute.name: burstDescriptor
attribute.comment: Describes munitions used in the firing event

attribute.name: rangeToTarget
attribute.comment: range to the target. Note the word range is a SQL reserved word.

class.name: DetonationPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.4.2. Information about stuff exploding. COMPLETE

attribute.name: munitionID
attribute.comment: ID of muntion that was fired

attribute.name: locationInWorldCoordinates
attribute.comment: where the detonation is, in world coordinates

attribute.name: locationInEntityCoordinates
attribute.comment: location of the detonation or impact in the target entity's coordinate system. This information should be used for damage assessment.

attribute.name: numberOfArticulationParameters
attribute.comment: How many articulation parameters we have

class.name: LogisticsFamilyPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.5. Abstract superclass for logistics PDUs. COMPLETE

class.name: ServiceRequestPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.5.1. Information about a request for supplies. COMPLETE

attribute.name: servicingEntityID
attribute.comment: Entity that is providing the service

class.name: ResupplyOfferPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.5.2. Information about a request for supplies. COMPLETE

attribute.name: numberOfSupplyTypes
attribute.comment: how many supplies are being offered

class.name: ResupplyReceivedPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.5.3. Receipt of supplies is communiated. COMPLETE

attribute.name: numberOfSupplyTypes
attribute.comment: how many supplies are being offered

class.name: ResupplyCancelPdu
class.comment: Section 5.2.5.4. Cancel of resupply by either the receiving or supplying entity. COMPLETE

class.name: RepairCompletePdu
class.comment: Section 5.2.5.5. Repair is complete. COMPLETE

attribute.name: padding2
attribute.comment: padding, number prevents conflict with superclass ivar name

class.name: RepairResponsePdu
class.comment: Section 5.2.5.6. Sent after repair complete PDU. COMPLETE

class.name: SimulationManagementFamilyPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.6. Abstract superclass for PDUs relating to the simulation itself. COMPLETE

attribute.name: receivingEntityID
attribute.comment: Entity that is intended to receive message

class.name: CreateEntityPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.6.1. Create a new entity. COMPLETE

class.name: RemoveEntityPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.6.2. Remove an entity. COMPLETE

class.name: StartResumePdu
class.comment: Section 5.2.6.3. Start or resume an exercise. COMPLETE

attribute.name: realWorldTime
attribute.comment: UTC time at which the simulation shall start or resume

attribute.name: simulationTime
attribute.comment: Simulation clock time at which the simulation shall start or resume

class.name: StopFreezePdu
class.comment: Section 5.2.3.4. Stop or freeze an exercise. COMPLETE

attribute.name: realWorldTime
attribute.comment: UTC time at which the simulation shall stop or freeze

attribute.name: reason
attribute.comment: Reason the simulation was stopped or frozen

attribute.name: frozenBehavior
attribute.comment: Internal behavior of the simulation and its appearance while frozento the other participants

class.name: AcknowledgePdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.6.5. Acknowledge the receiptof a start/resume, stop/freeze, or RemoveEntityPDU. COMPLETE

attribute.name: responseFlag
attribute.comment: Whether or not the receiving entity was able to comply with the request

class.name: ActionRequestPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.6.6. Request from simulation manager to an entity. COMPLETE

attribute.name: fixedDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of fixed datums

attribute.name: variableDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of variable length datums

class.name: ActionResponsePdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.6.7. response to an action request PDU. COMPLETE

attribute.name: fixedDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of fixed datums

attribute.name: variableDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of variable length datums

class.name: DataQueryPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.6.8. Request for data from an entity. COMPLETE

attribute.name: timeInterval
attribute.comment: time issues between issues of Data PDUs. Zero means send once only.

attribute.name: fixedDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of fixed datums

attribute.name: variableDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of variable length datums

class.name: SetDataPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.6.9. Change state information with the data contained in this. COMPLETE

attribute.name: fixedDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of fixed datums

attribute.name: variableDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of variable length datums

class.name: DataPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.6.10. Information issued in response to a data query pdu or a set data pdu is communicated using a data pdu. COMPLETE

attribute.name: fixedDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of fixed datums

attribute.name: variableDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of variable length datums

class.name: EventReportPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.6.11. Reports occurance of a significant event to the simulation manager. COMPLETE

attribute.name: fixedDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of fixed datums

attribute.name: variableDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of variable length datums

class.name: CommentPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.6.12. Arbitrary messages can be entered into the data stream via use of this PDU. COMPLETE

attribute.name: fixedDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of fixed datums

attribute.name: variableDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of variable length datums

class.name: DistributedEmissionsFamilyPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.7. Electronic Emissions. Abstract superclass for distirubted emissions PDU

class.name: ElectronicEmissionsPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.7.1. Information about active electronic warfare (EW) emissions and active EW countermeasures shall be communicated using an Electromagnetic Emission PDU. COMPLETE (I think)

attribute.name: stateUpdateIndicator
attribute.comment: This field shall be used to indicate if the data in the PDU represents a state update or just data that has changed since issuance of the last Electromagnetic Emission PDU [relative to the identified entity and emission system(s)].

attribute.name: numberOfSystems
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the number of emission systems being described in the current PDU.

class.name: DesignatorPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.7.2. Handles designating operations. COMPLETE

attribute.name: codeName
attribute.comment: This field shall specify a unique emitter database number assigned to differentiate between otherwise similar or identical emitter beams within an emitter system.

attribute.name: designatedEntityID
attribute.comment: ID of the entity being designated

attribute.name: designatorCode
attribute.comment: This field shall identify the designator code being used by the designating entity

attribute.name: designatorPower
attribute.comment: This field shall identify the designator output power in watts

attribute.name: designatorWavelength
attribute.comment: This field shall identify the designator wavelength in units of microns

attribute.name: designatorSpotWrtDesignated
attribute.comment: designtor spot wrt the designated entity

attribute.name: designatorSpotLocation
attribute.comment: designtor spot wrt the designated entity

class.name: UaPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.7.3. Information about underwater acoustic emmissions. This requires manual cleanup. The beam data records should ALL be a the finish, rather than attached to each emitter system. UNFINISHED

attribute.name: emittingEntityID
attribute.comment: ID of the entity that is the source of the emission

attribute.name: stateChangeIndicator
attribute.comment: This field shall be used to indicate whether the data in the UA PDU represent a state update or data that have changed since issuance of the last UA PDU

attribute.name: passiveParameterIndex
attribute.comment: This field indicates which database record (or file) shall be used in the definition of passive signature (unintentional) emissions of the entity. The indicated database record (or file) shall define all noise generated as a function of propulsion plant configurations and associated auxiliaries.

attribute.name: propulsionPlantConfiguration
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the entity propulsion plant configuration. This field is used to determine the passive signature characteristics of an entity.

attribute.name: numberOfShafts
attribute.comment: This field shall represent the number of shafts on a platform

attribute.name: numberOfAPAs
attribute.comment: This field shall indicate the number of APAs described in the current UA PDU

attribute.name: numberOfUAEmitterSystems
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the number of UA emitter systems being described in the current UA PDU

class.name: IffAtcNavAidsLayer1Pdu
class.comment: 5.3.7.4.1: Navigational and IFF PDU. COMPLETE

attribute.name: emittingEntityId
attribute.comment: ID of the entity that is the source of the emissions

attribute.name: eventID
attribute.comment: Number generated by the issuing simulation to associate realted events.

attribute.name: location
attribute.comment: Location wrt entity. There is some ambugiuity in the standard here, but this is the order it is listed in the table.

class.name: IffAtcNavAidsLayer2Pdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.7.4.2 When present, layer 2 should follow layer 1 and have the following fields. This requires manual cleanup. the beamData attribute semantics are used in multiple ways. UNFINSISHED

attribute.name: fundamentalIffParameters
attribute.comment: variable length list of fundamental parameters. ^^^This is wrong

class.name: SeesPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.7.5. SEES PDU, supplemental emissions entity state information. COMPLETE

attribute.name: propulsionSystemData
attribute.comment: variable length list of propulsion system data

attribute.name: vectoringSystemData
attribute.comment: variable length list of vectoring system data

class.name: RadioCommunicationsFamilyPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.8. Abstract superclass for radio communications PDUs.

class.name: IntercomSignalPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.8.4. Actual transmission of intercome voice data. COMPLETE

attribute.name: entityId
attribute.comment: ID of the entitythat is the source of the communication

class.name: TransmitterPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.8.1. Detailed information about a radio transmitter. This PDU requires manually written code to complete, since the modulation parameters are of variable length. UNFINISHED

attribute.name: entityId
attribute.comment: ID of the entity that is the source of the communication, ie contains the radio

attribute.name: relativeAntennaLocation
attribute.comment: relative location of antenna, in entity coordinates

attribute.name: modulationParameterCount
attribute.comment: how many modulation parameters we have

attribute.name: modulationParametersList
attribute.comment: variable length list of modulation parameters

attribute.name: antennaPatternList
attribute.comment: variable length list of antenna pattern records

class.name: SignalPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.8.2. Detailed information about a radio transmitter. This PDU requires manually written code to complete. The encodingScheme field can be used in multiple ways, which requires hand-written code to finish. UNFINISHED

attribute.name: entityId
attribute.comment: ID of the entity that is the source of the communication, ie contains the radio

attribute.name: samples
attribute.comment: number of samples. If the PDU contains encoded audio, this should be zero.

attribute.name: data
attribute.comment: list of eight bit values. Must be padded to fall on a 32 bit boundary.

class.name: ReceiverPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.8.3. Communication of a receiver state. COMPLETE

attribute.name: entityId
attribute.comment: ID of the entity that is the source of the communication, ie contains the radio

class.name: IntercomControlPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.8.5. Detailed inofrmation about the state of an intercom device and the actions it is requestion of another intercom device, or the response to a requested action. Required manual intervention to fix the intercom parameters, which can be of varialbe length. UNFINSISHED

attribute.name: sourceCommunicationsDeviceID
attribute.comment: The specific intercom device being simulated within an entity.

attribute.name: sourceLineID
attribute.comment: Line number to which the intercom control refers

attribute.name: transmitPriority
attribute.comment: priority of this message relative to transmissons from other intercom devices

attribute.name: transmitLineState
attribute.comment: current transmit state of the line

attribute.name: masterEntityID
attribute.comment: eid of the entity that has created this intercom channel.

attribute.name: masterCommunicationsDeviceID
attribute.comment: specific intercom device that has created this intercom channel

class.name: EntityManagementFamilyPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.9. Common superclass for EntityManagment PDUs, including aggregate state, isGroupOf, TransferControLRequest, and isPartOf

class.name: AggregateStatePdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.9.1 informationa bout aggregating entities anc communicating information about the aggregated entities. requires manual intervention to fix the padding between entityID lists and silent aggregate sysem lists--this padding is dependent on how many entityIDs there are, and needs to be on a 32 bit word boundary. UNFINISHED

attribute.name: aggregateType
attribute.comment: entity type of the aggregated entities

attribute.name: aggregateMarking
attribute.comment: marking for aggregate; first char is charset type, rest is char data

attribute.name: dimensions
attribute.comment: dimensions of bounding box for the aggregated entities, origin at the center of mass

attribute.name: centerOfMass
attribute.comment: center of mass of the aggregation

attribute.name: pad2
attribute.comment: ^^^padding to put the start of the next list on a 32 bit boundary. This needs to be fixed

class.name: IsGroupOfPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.9.2 Information about a particular group of entities grouped together for the purposes of netowrk bandwidth reduction or aggregation. Needs manual cleanup. The GED size requires a database lookup. UNFINISHED

attribute.name: groupedEntityCategory
attribute.comment: type of entities constituting the group

attribute.name: numberOfGroupedEntities
attribute.comment: Number of individual entities constituting the group

attribute.name: groupedEntityDescriptions
attribute.comment: GED records about each individual entity in the group. ^^^this is wrong--need a database lookup to find the actual size of the list elements

class.name: TransferControlRequestPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.9.3 Information initiating the dyanic allocation and control of simulation entities between two simulation applications. Requires manual cleanup. The padding between record sets is variable. UNFINISHED

attribute.name: transferEntityID
attribute.comment: The entity for which control is being requested to transfer

attribute.name: numberOfRecordSets
attribute.comment: number of record sets to transfer

attribute.name: recordSets
attribute.comment: ^^^This is wrong--the RecordSet class needs more work

class.name: IsPartOfPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.9.4 The joining of two or more simulation entities is communicated by this PDU. COMPLETE

attribute.name: partLocation
attribute.comment: location of part; centroid of part in host's coordinate system. x=range, y=bearing, z=0

class.name: MinefieldFamilyPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.10.1 Abstract superclass for PDUs relating to minefields

class.name: MinefieldStatePdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.10.1 Abstract superclass for PDUs relating to minefields. COMPLETE

attribute.name: minefieldLocation
attribute.comment: location of minefield in world coords

class.name: MinefieldQueryPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.10.2 Query a minefield for information about individual mines. Requires manual clean up to get the padding right. UNFINISHED

attribute.name: requestingEntityID
attribute.comment: EID of entity making the request

attribute.name: numberOfPerimeterPoints
attribute.comment: Number of perimeter points for the minefield

attribute.name: requestedMineType
attribute.comment: Entity type of mine being requested

class.name: MinefieldDataPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.10.3 Information about individual mines within a minefield. This is very, very wrong. UNFINISHED

attribute.name: numberOfMinesInThisPdu
attribute.comment: how many mines are in this PDU

attribute.name: numberOfSensorTypes
attribute.comment: how many sensor type are in this PDU

attribute.name: pad3
attribute.comment: Padding to get things 32-bit aligned. ^^^this is wrong--dyanmically sized padding needed

class.name: MinefieldResponseNackPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.10.4 proivde the means to request a retransmit of a minefield data pdu. COMPLETE

attribute.name: missingPduSequenceNumbers
attribute.comment: PDU sequence numbers that were missing

class.name: SyntheticEnvironmentFamilyPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.11: Abstract superclass for synthetic environment PDUs

class.name: EnvironmentalProcessPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.11.1: Information about environmental effects and processes. This requires manual cleanup. the environmental record is variable, as is the padding. UNFINISHED

attribute.name: sequenceNumber
attribute.comment: PDU sequence number for the environmentla process if pdu sequencing required

class.name: GriddedDataPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.11.2: Information about globat, spatially varying enviornmental effects. This requires manual cleanup; the grid axis records are variable sized. UNFINISHED

attribute.name: fieldNumber
attribute.comment: unique identifier for each piece of enviornmental data

attribute.name: pduNumber
attribute.comment: sequence number for the total set of PDUS used to transmit the data

attribute.name: pduTotal
attribute.comment: Total number of PDUS used to transmit the data

attribute.name: numberOfGridAxes
attribute.comment: number of grid axes for the environmental data

attribute.name: constantGrid
attribute.comment: are domain grid axes identidal to those of the priveious domain update?

attribute.name: sampleTime
attribute.comment: valid time of the enviormental data sample, 64 bit unsigned int

attribute.name: totalValues
attribute.comment: total number of all data values for all pdus for an environmental sample

attribute.name: vectorDimension
attribute.comment: total number of data values at each grid point.

class.name: PointObjectStatePdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.11.3: Inormation abut the addition or modification of a synthecic enviroment object that is anchored to the terrain with a single point. COMPLETE

attribute.name: referencedObjectID
attribute.comment: Object with which this point object is associated

attribute.name: updateNumber
attribute.comment: unique update number of each state transition of an object

class.name: LinearObjectStatePdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.11.4: Information abut the addition or modification of a synthecic enviroment object that is anchored to the terrain with a single point and has size or orientation. COMPLETE

attribute.name: referencedObjectID
attribute.comment: Object with which this point object is associated

attribute.name: updateNumber
attribute.comment: unique update number of each state transition of an object

class.name: ArealObjectStatePdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.11.5: Information about the addition/modification of an oobject that is geometrically achored to the terrain with a set of three or more points that come to a closure. COMPLETE

attribute.name: referencedObjectID
attribute.comment: Object with which this point object is associated

attribute.name: updateNumber
attribute.comment: unique update number of each state transition of an object

class.name: SimulationManagementWithReliabilityFamilyPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.12: Abstract superclass for reliable simulation management PDUs

attribute.name: receivingEntityID
attribute.comment: Object with which this point object is associated

class.name: CreateEntityReliablePdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.12.1: creation of an entity , reliable. COMPLETE

attribute.name: requiredReliabilityService
attribute.comment: level of reliability service used for this transaction

class.name: RemoveEntityReliablePdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.12.2: Removal of an entity , reliable. COMPLETE

attribute.name: requiredReliabilityService
attribute.comment: level of reliability service used for this transaction

class.name: StartResumeReliablePdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.12.3: Start resume simulation, relaible. COMPLETE

attribute.name: realWorldTime
attribute.comment: time in real world for this operation to happen

attribute.name: simulationTime
attribute.comment: time in simulation for the simulation to resume

attribute.name: requiredReliabilityService
attribute.comment: level of reliability service used for this transaction

class.name: StopFreezeReliablePdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.12.4: Stop freeze simulation, relaible. COMPLETE

attribute.name: realWorldTime
attribute.comment: time in real world for this operation to happen

attribute.name: frozenBehavior
attribute.comment: internal behvior of the simulation while frozen

class.name: AcknowledgeReliablePdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.12.5: Ack receipt of a start-resume, stop-freeze, create-entity or remove enitty (reliable) pdus. COMPLETE

class.name: ActionRequestReliablePdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.12.6: request from a simulation manager to a managed entity to perform a specified action. COMPLETE

attribute.name: requiredReliabilityService
attribute.comment: level of reliability service used for this transaction

class.name: ActionResponseReliablePdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.12.7: Response from an entity to an action request PDU. COMPLETE

class.name: DataQueryReliablePdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.12.8: request for data from an entity. COMPLETE

attribute.name: requiredReliabilityService
attribute.comment: level of reliability service used for this transaction

attribute.name: timeInterval
attribute.comment: time interval between issuing data query PDUs

class.name: SetDataReliablePdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.12.9: initializing or chaning internal state information, reliable. Needs manual intervention to fix padding on variable datums. UNFINISHED

attribute.name: requiredReliabilityService
attribute.comment: level of reliability service used for this transaction

class.name: DataReliablePdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.12.10: issued in response to a data query R or set dataR pdu. Needs manual intervention to fix padding on variable datums. UNFINSIHED

attribute.name: requiredReliabilityService
attribute.comment: level of reliability service used for this transaction

class.name: EventReportReliablePdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.12.11: reports the occurance of a significatnt event to the simulation manager. Needs manual intervention to fix padding in variable datums. UNFINISHED.

class.name: CommentReliablePdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.12.12: Arbitrary messages. Only reliable this time. Neds manual intervention to fix padding in variable datums. UNFINISHED

class.name: RecordQueryReliablePdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.12.13: A request for one or more records of data from an entity. COMPLETE

attribute.name: requiredReliabilityService
attribute.comment: level of reliability service used for this transaction

attribute.name: pad1
attribute.comment: padding. The spec is unclear and contradictory here.

class.name: SetRecordReliablePdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.12.14: Initializing or changing internal parameter info. Needs manual intervention to fix padding in recrod set PDUs. UNFINISHED

attribute.name: requiredReliabilityService
attribute.comment: level of reliability service used for this transaction

attribute.name: pad1
attribute.comment: padding. The spec is unclear and contradictory here.

attribute.name: numberOfRecordSets
attribute.comment: Number of record sets in list

class.name: PduContainer
class.comment: Used for XML compatability. A container that holds PDUs

attribute.name: numberOfPdus
attribute.comment: Number of PDUs in the container list
